head.title: Welcome to Seymour Community School District

div.h2: SCSD Schools Closed for the Remainder of this School Year

div.h2: Thinking of our Seniors and spring athletes

div.div: Seymour High School turned on the lights in support of our students!Â

div.h2: Food pick up Monday, Wednesday & Friday 10-12

div.div: Thank you to our Seymour School District Food Service staff! They are working hard preparing free meals for our students while they are away from school. Pick up is available at Rock Ledge Intermediate, Black Creek School, Oneida Rec Lot on Highway H, Nichols Community Center, Isaar - St. Sebastian, and Osborn Town Hall.

div.p:
District Newsletters Â Click HERE!Â Â Â
District Announcements Click HERE!Â
Please visit our updates webpage for the latest information.

March 17, 2020 Dear Seymour Families, Beginning Thursday, March 19th we will be providing free meals to our families.Â This week we will provide meals on Thursday and Friday. Beginning the week of March 23rd we will be providing meals on Monday, Wednesday and Friday.Â Each day you will be able to pick up two breakfasts and two lunch meals per student. The meals will be available at the following locations from 10am until noon.Â The locations are: - St Sebastian Parking Lot
Osborn - Town Hall Parking Lot
Oneida - Recreational Building on Hwy H Parking Lot
Nichols - Community Center Parking Lot (Baseball Diamond)
Seymour - Rock Ledge Intermediate School Front DoorÂ
Black Creek - Black Creek School Front Door I have included a link for you to complete if you are planning on using our meal service.Â Please indicate which location and how many meals you will be picking up each day. This will allow us to prepare the appropriate number of meals.Â If you access the call the district office at 920-833-2304 and indicate which location and # of meals.Â Â Â Survey for Meal Pick Up Â We understand this closure presents a wide range of challenges to our families and students. Thank you for your efforts as you work to take care of yourself and your loved ones. Â Laurie Asher
Superintendent Â Â
Parent Student Page has all Virtual Learning Information

div.p: The mission of Seymour Community School District is to create a cooperative community of people committed to constantly improving learning environments which enable students to demonstrate their uniqueness as persons who are active learners, caring members of society, creative artists, ethical stewards, involved citizens, and productive workers.
